alert.note: Alert for San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 6:42PM PDT until further notice by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 815 PM PDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of southeast California and southern California, including the following counties, in southeast California, Inyo. In southern California, San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 815 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 640 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated that heavy rain due to thunderstorms continues in the advisory area, and minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Death Valley National Park, Badwater Road, and West Side Road. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
